title: Pangram
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803082534/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803082534/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Pangram**

Pangrams are short passages that include all 26 characters of the [alphabet](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803082534/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Alphabets). They're commonly used to help users of the font quickly assess a character set. They may also be useful to designers in the process of designing their own work but they are too compact for a more thorough assessment. Perhaps the most common pangram is _The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog._

Clever pangrams:  
_Boxer M. Tyson packs his bags with Jay-Z DVDs, Quik, Holyfield's ear._ -- BJ Harvey

_Typophile Boxing! Papazian jousts with quaking, anonymous detractor. Fight at eleven._ -- [Joe Pemberton](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803082534/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Joseph%20Pemberton)

_Abacist’s deaf dog hijacked luminous parquetry studio, avows ex-yakuza._ -- [Hrant Papazian](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803082534/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hrant%20Papazian) (This is a rare, alphabetically ordered pangram.)

_Wham! Volcano erupts fiery liquid death onto ex-jazzbo Kenny G._ -- [Jonathan Hoefler](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803082534/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jonathan%20Hoefler)
